sense.gloss: tax paid to avoid forced labor (ritsuryō period), tax in kind
middle way, (golden) mean, moderation, middle path
the Doctrine of the Mean (one of the Four Books)
corvee, taxes in kind or service (ritsuryō system)
ordinary and ignorant, mediocre and stupid

sdata.j: ↑何事↑↓なにごと↓にも↑中庸↑↓ちゅうよう↓。
↑都会↑↓とかい↓と↑田舎↑↓いなか↓の↑生活↑↓せいかつ↓の↑中庸↑↓ちゅうよう↓を↑見↑↓み↓つけるのは↑難↑↓むずか↓しい。
sdata.e: It is difficult to find a happy medium between city and countryside.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑中庸↑↓ちゅうよう↓を↑心得↑↓こころえ↓たじんぶつである。
sdata.e: He is man of moderate views.

sdata.j: ↑人気者↑↓にんきもの↓になるためには、↑凡庸↑↓ぼんよう↓でなくてはならない。
sdata.e: To become popular, you need to be mediocre.

sdata.j: ↑賢↑↓かしこ↓い↑人↑↓ひと↓の↑手↑↓て↓にかかると、↑物事↑↓ものごと↓は↑実↑↓じつ↓にシンプルになる。↑簡単↑↓かんたん↓なことを↑難↑↓むずか↓しく↑言↑↓い↓うのが、↑賢↑↓かしこ↓いふりをした↑凡庸↑↓ぼんよう↓な↑人間↑↓にんげん↓だ。
sdata.e: In the hands of a wise person, things become really simple. It's a mediocre person, pretending to be wise, that makes an easy thing sound difficult.

words.gloss: tax paid to avoid forced labor (ritsuryō period), tax in kind
